intro: Silene fabaria subsp. domokina, commonly known as the Balkan campion, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It is characterized by its pink or purple flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the Caryophyllaceae family. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, such as slopes and grasslands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to its environment.
